title: USC's Steve Sarkisian placed on leave; LSU asst. Ed Orgeron a possible target? | Podcast
text:
USC coach Steve Sarkisian will take a leave of absence and seek treatment, athletic director Pat Haden announced Sunday.
The second-year head coach has run into scrutiny for multiple off-field incidents already, with the Trojans also drawing some on-field criticism with two losses in the past three weeks.
Offensive coordinator Clay Helton will take charge for the time-being.
LA TIMES: USC PLACES SARKISIAN ON LEAVE But LSU defensive line coach Ed Orgeron, the team's interim head coach for eight games in 2013, will undoubtedly be among the first and hottest names tied to the position if or when it becomes officially available.
Story by Jerit Roser
- and -
James Smith
NOLA.com | The Times-Picayune
The Louisiana native served as assistant head coach, defensive line coach and recruiting coordinator at USC from 1998 to 2004 before spending three seasons as head coach at Ole Miss.
Orgeron rejoined the Trojans staff in 2010 for three seasons until raking the reins from Lane Kiffin during 2013, but being passed over for the position on a full-time basis in favor of Sarkisian.
Helton coached the team in the bowl game that season after Orgeron's depature.
NOLA.com | The Times-Picayune writers Jerit Roser and James Smith discussed the topic in the podcast below.
Orgeron still has the support of some boosters who thought he should've received the position in 2014, Smith said.
